--- title: DIY Datalake - dithering around with dbt & duckdb draft: true --- DONE - create duckdb instance ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import duckdb import pandas as pd import numpy as np cursor = duckdb.connect(database=':memory:') ``` ::: TODO - read data into pandas dataframes from data folder ::: {.cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} my_df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict({'a': [42]}) cursor.execute("CREATE TABLE my_table AS SELECT * FROM my_df") cursor.execute("INSERT INTO my_table SELECT * FROM my_df") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ``` ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} cursor.execute("SELECT * FROM my_table").fetch_df() # headers = df1.iloc[0] # df1 = df1[1:] # df1.columns = headers # df1 = df1.loc[:, df1.columns.notna()] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=3} ```{=html}
a
0 42
1 42
``` ::: ::: TODO - find common indeces and normalize data TODO - create visualizations
